comments:
I got this while renaming a file (xsl, not java).
I've also gotten a similar exception while creating a new Junit test suite
(using the wizard.)
This may be a dup of one of the other Invalid thread access bugs, but they were
reported for different things (startup, OSX). This is Windows and happens during
normal use.

This is not an SWT bug but a bug in org.eclipse.ltk - however, I have never 
heard of this plugin and don't know which group to route this bug report to.
Is JDT/UI the right place to assign these problems?

This got fixed for RC2 (build 200406111814). Christopher, which build are you 
using.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 66548 ***

I've got RC2 now -- I'll look at the other bug and see if the repro steps are
better. Otherwise, I guess I'll use RC2 a while and see if I see it any more :-/

Thanks!
